results.description:
There are three main thrusting attacks used in the gatotsu, and all of them are used for power and depend heavily on the first strike.

Even Kenshin was nearly defeated by these attacks.
results.deck: The gatotsu is a strong thrusting style, most notably used by Hajime Saito.
results.name: Gatotsu

results.description:
This List doesn't have any kind of ranking, however it is separated depending of the kind of origin that the intelligence comes from. Ex: Human, Alien, Machines, etc. Not because a character is above another one means that he/she is smarter than the other one.

  • Science: A character with great intelligence who is an expert in any kind of scientific or engineering field.
  • Arts: Characters that use intellect/creativity to create different kinds of art, such as painting and music.
  • Tactics and Strategy: A character that uses his/her great intellect to create tactics and/or strategies to win in almost any scenario.
  • Street Level: Characters who use their intelligence to solve a mystery using his/her detective skills. This also includes the area of criminal psychology.
  • Magic: These characters have gained great power and knowledge thanks to the arts of the magic and illusion.
  • Criminal Intelligence: Those who are intelligent in criminal activities such as Joker.

Human Intelligence

The intellect of a human who’s I.Q. hasn’t been increased using external help like machines, serums, powers (the powers are the ones that grant the superior intellect), etc.

Examples

Batman: Bruce Wayne is one of the most brilliant humans on Earth often paired alongside Lex Luthor and Michael Holt. Trained by the elites he has a complete balance between his body (with peak human condition) and intellect, and his intelligence is quite versatile allowing him to be rather skilled in most areas, but especially in the science of detection. He is The World's Greatest Detective. Types of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Street Level.

Ray Palmer: Ray Palmer is quite possibly the smartest human on Earth, however this is only in a single field unlike some of the more famed geniuses like Batman or Lex Luthor. This genius has been able to use particle physics to create a belt that can manipulate his size to being as small as one atom. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Atom: Ryan Choi, Ray Palmer’s successor in taking up the Atom mantle was chosen by Ray Palmer himself to become the new Atom because of his great intellect. He had been Ray's student for quite some time and so he too is quite well-versed in the field of science. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Mr. Terrific: Michael Holt is often referred to as the “third smartest human” and is a genius of both science and tactics. He has been known to have been able to create, from scratch, technologies that no other human had invented previously. He is also an elite member of Checkmate, a group who are known for being able to think two steps ahead. Type of Intelligence: Science and Tactics.

Lex Luthor: Lex Luthor is a human with a superlative intellect that he uses to pursue his obsession with killing Superman. He is quite similar to Batman, in that he is a polymath (a genius in various areas), and because of this is often mentioned with Batman and Mr. Terrific as the smartest men on Earth. Types of Intelligence: Science, Criminal Intelligence and Tactics/Strategy.

Joker: Although he is often considered to be merely a homicidal clown because of his appearance and the way he is always joking, he is actually a man with a great intellect which can rival that of the mighty Batman himself. Type of Intelligence: Science and Criminal Intelligence.

Ted Kord: Ted Kord is the second person to use the name Blue Beetle, however, the difference between him and his predecessor was that he decided not to use the blue scarab that was thought to be of magic origin. The reason behind this was that Ted Kord had always been a science guy up until the day of his death. Types of Intelligence: Science and Street Level.

Will Magnus: Doctor Magnus is an expert in robotics and he was the man that created the Metal Men; possibly the most advanced robots created by a human, even up to centuries after Magnus' time. Type of Intelligence: Science/Engineering.

The Chief: Niles Caulder, better known as The Chief was the man who saved the members of the Doom Patrol after the disasters that should have killed them. This man is incredibly intelligent and has a great knowledge from anything that has to do with implants, medicine, and anatomy, psychology, etc. He and his rival, The Brain, often went head-to-head as few could compare their intelligence to Caulder's level. Type of Intelligence: Science, Street Level.

Steel: John Henry Irons is a genius specialized in creating and designing powered exoskeletons using metal bases. In order to honor Superman after his death fighting Doomsday, Irons built a bulletproof suit of armor whose computerized pneumatic exoskeleton joints gave him superhuman strength. It is thanks to his own genius that he has provided himself with powers instead of vice versa. Type of Intelligence: Science/Engineering.

Dr. Sivana: Thaddeus Bodog Sivana is a human with great intelligence, having an obsession to kill Captain Marvel and his allies similar to the obsession that Lex Luthor has towards Superman. He uses his great intellect to create all kinds of ways to eliminate Captain Marvel and is considered one of the most brilliant mad scientists on Earth. Type of Intelligence: Science, Criminal Intelligence.

Gizmo: Mikron O'Jeneus is a genius that can create some of the most powerful devices and weapons with some of the most ordinary items. Gizmo was indeed one of the world’s greatest engineers, all the way up until the day he was murdered. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Calculator: The Calculator was once one of the many laughable villains of Gotham City until the day he made a decision that changed his status forever. This was to use all of his great intellect to gain information that he would later sell to villains. In some ways similar to Barbara Gordon’s services to the hero community just with a villainous twist. Types of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Criminal Intelligence.

Ra's al Ghul: Ra’s al Ghul is the leader of the League of Assassins, and has been able to cheat death for centuries. Ra’s al Ghul is probably the best swordsman on Earth, however his true gifts are his great knowledge of the sciences and his great tactical mind. Ra’s al Ghul is one of the few people on Earth that can be considered the equal of Batman on any intellectual level. Types of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Criminal Intelligence.

Lucius Fox: Lucius Fox is the current CEO and President of Wayne Enterprises and a sought after businessman all over the corporate world. He is a great financial officer and a good friend/ally to Bruce Wayne. He was also the man that designed most of Batman’s gadgets, making him a great inventor. So even though his type of intelligence differs from the norm he is still credited as being in the same category as geniuses such as Ray Palmer. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Nightwing: Having been Bruce Wayne’s ward he received the best education and tutelage the world could offer. However even before he ever became Bruce Wayne’s ward he was known to be the best in almost any school he attended while he was a member of the Flying Graysons. Dick Grayson is also known to be one of the great master tacticians as well as one of the world’s greatest detectives, and one very good scientist in his own right. Types of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Street Level.

Oracle: Barbara Gordon is a woman that has always been someone with great knowledge of how to use a computer to its real potential. It was this skill that helped her as a detective when she was Batgirl. However, when she was brutally shot by the Joker she was rendered a paraplegic leading to the end of her days as a costumed vigilante. Yet she decided to use her great knowledge of computers to get top secret information and organize the hero community against the villains of the world, creating the team of female heroes, Birds of Prey. Types of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Street Level.

Tim Drake: Tim Drake is the third person to assume the mantle of Robin. He gained this title some time after he discovered at a young age something that the best detectives haven’t been able to discover, the identity of Batman. Tim Drake dreams to become the world’s greatest detective, a title that is currently in possession of Batman, however Bruce Wayne is sure that Drake will one day become a better detective than him. Although Tim is the lest talented fighter of all Robins, he makes up for his slightly inferior fighting skills with an overall intelligence superior to all of his counterparts as Robin (With the possible exception of Damien Wayne). Types of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Street Level.

Buddy Blank: Buddy Blank is the man who was recently revealed to have invented one of the most powerful and advanced machines the Earth and the universe have ever witnessed, Brother Eye. Just the invention of this technology is enough to rank Buddy Blank as one of the most intelligent and powerful minds that the world has ever known. Type of Intelligence: Science/Engineering.

Scarecrow: Jonathan Crane knows perfectly how the mind of a human works. That advantage, paired with his great knowledge of science, is what helped him to create his fear gas that, when inhaled, causes the victim to confront their worst fears. Type of Intelligence: Science and Criminal Intelligence.

Mad Hatter: Jervis Tetch is like almost all of Batman’s villains...a criminal that has great knowledge of the mind and attacks on an mental/emotional level rather than a physical one. He invented a device that lets him control people to the point of doing whatever he desires them to do. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Riddler: Edward Nigma is a man that has always been obsessed with puzzles and riddles. These riddles, a result of a psychological compulsion to always tell the truth, established his proclivity for villainous activity. Using this obsession, he creates some of the most complex riddles to test even a genius mind to its very limits. Type of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy, Criminal Intelligence and Street Level.

Rip Hunter: Rip Hunter is known as the man that protects the time stream, thanks to his great intelligence he is not only able to monitor the time stream, but was able to eliminate any possibility of someone learning his real name; having erased himself from history. This proves that his intelligence is far beyond that of an ordinary mortal, as he would have to possess extensive knowledge of both the limits of his powers and knowing what needs to be done to remove himself from the past. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Trickster: Although his appearance may suggest otherwise, James Jesse is one of the most intelligent persons on Earth, possibly on a par with Winslow Schott and Doctor Sivana. This young inventor created some of his own personal gadgets like the flying boots and an invisibility field. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Jericho: Joseph Wilson is the youngest son of none other than the villain, Deathstroke the Terminator. However, instead of being like his father or brother Grant Wilson (the original Ravager) he is a man calm in nature and forsakes all ideas of villainy; instead accepting peace and expanding upon his great abilities in both painting and creating music. Type of Intelligence: Arts.

Hartley Rathaway (Pied Piper): Hartley Rathaway (Pied Piper) is obsessed with the music and thanks to this obsession and his great intellect he has been able to use certain frequencies of musical notes to control the minds of animals and even humans. Type (s) of intelligence: Arts.

Doctor Fate: Many people have used the name of Doctor Fate in history; yet everyone who becomes Doctor Fate must have a great intellect and acquire great knowledge of the hidden arts of magic and illusion. He is also the one human that has had the most extensive knowledge of magic. Type(s) of intelligence: Magic.

Zatanna : Zatanna is like Doctor Fate; a human who has esoteric knowledge of magic thanks to her exceptional intelligence she has been able to obtain a great control making her one of the most powerful magicians the comics have ever known. Type (s) of intelligence: Magic.

Firestorm: Firestorm is not only one of the most powerful non-cosmic beings of the universe, but he also has the mind of a scientist that allows him an uncanny knowledge of the elements. Type (s) of intelligence: Science.

Maxwell Lord: Maxwell lord is a human with a lot of money and a superior intellect. Maxwell Lord would help to fund the Justice League International in order to make people realize the ways in which metahumans are dangerous for humanity. He also took control over Checkmate and the machine known as Brother Eye. Type (s) of intelligence: Science and Tactics/Strategy.

Winslow Schott (Toyman): Toyman is a human who is able to create all kinds of mechanical devices to use against humanity and Superman. One of the best inventors in the DC universe. Type (s) of intelligence: Science/Engineering.

Ralph Dibny (Elongated Man): One of the greatest detectives on Earth. Ralph Dibny better known as the Elongated Man has detective skills that rival even those of Batman.

Type (s) of intelligence: Street Level.

Pieter Cross (Doctor Mid-Nite): Pieter Cross is the best surgeon in the world, there are just a few cases that the skill of this great doctor can't cure. Type (s) of intelligence: Science

Harvey Bullock: With an appearance that betrays his true abilities, Harvey Bullock is one very skilled policeman and detective. Although he is a former corrupt cop he is now one of the most respected policemen in Gotham City and the entire country.

James Gordon: James Gordon is the commissioner of Gotham City's police department. The best policeman in the country and Batman's right hand, he has claimed that if he ever so desired, he would be able to discover Batman's true identity. Type (s) of intelligence: Street Level/Criminal Psychology.

Jason Todd (Red Hood): Jason Todd was the second person to become Batman's sidekick, Robin. He was trained by the Dark Knight in detective skills, fighting skills, etc just like Dick Grayson before him. He would later be brutally killed by the Joker. When Jason Todd was revived he was submerged in a Lazarus Pit which gave him "clarity", he apparently gained great knowledge of technology because he has been able to create a bomb that not even Batman was able to stop. Type (s) of intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Street Level.

Leslie Thompkins: Leslie Thompkins was one of the most trusted allies of Batman until the tragic day when she seemingly took Stephanie Brown's (Spoiler) life. She is a great doctor capable of saving almost any life....and also taking it. Type (s) of intelligence: Science.

Dr. Kirk Langstrom (Man-Bat): Dr. Kirk Langstrom was the scientific that was able to create a serum to mutate a human being into a monster with the form of a bat. Type (s) of intelligence: Science.

Charles Victor Szasz (The Question): The Question was not only a great fighter but also a detective par excellence. Using his superb intellect he is able to resolve mysteries that few others are able to solve. Type (s) of intelligence: Street Level.

Renee Montoya (The Question): The new Question and former member of the police department of Gotham City. This young ex-cop learned to resolve homicide crimes in the most dangerous city in the world. Type (s) of intelligence: Street Level.

Thomas Wayne: The father of Bruce Wayne (Batman) this man created Wayne Enterprises making him more wealthy and prolific than most. He was also an incredible surgeon. Type (s) of intelligence: Science.

Thomas Elliot (Hush): Thomas Elliot was the childhood best friend of Bruce Wayne (Batman). Thomas would decide to become a surgeon just like Bruce Wayne's (Batman) father, having enough skill to cure mutes. Type (s) of intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy.

Victor Fries (Mister Freeze): Mr. Freeze was originally called Mr. Zero and was intended to be a gimmick character. After appearing in Batman: the Animated Series, Mr. Freeze soon became a serious rival for Batman.

Victor Fries was a talented scientist married to the love of his life, Nora Fries. When Nora is diagnosed with a rare terminal illness, Victor's life began to spiral downhill. In a desperate attempt to save her life, he began work at a large company run by Ferris Boyle. Fries, as he couldn't find a way to cure Nora, found a way to place her in cryo-statis. In order to save Nora he had to steal equipment from the company for which he was working, leading to his tragic disfigurement. Type (s) of intelligence: Science

John Stewart (Green Lantern): John Stewart is one of the best architects in the world and also Hal Jordan's backup as a Green Lantern. He has a great intellect and imagination which lets him to design great buildings and also create great things with his power ring. Type (s) of intelligence: Science and Arts.

Jesse Chambers (Liberty Belle): Jesse Chambers inherited powers from both her parents: Liberty Belle, a super-strong heroine of yesteryear, and the late Jonny Chambers, aka Jonny Quick. Jonny, a super-speedster who drew energy from the Speed Force by mentally envisioning a specific geometrical construct nearly unimaginable in three-dimensional space, taught teenage Jesse his formula, hoping she would follow in his footsteps. Type (s) of intelligence: Science

Abra Kadabra: Abra Kadabra is from the 64th century Earth ruled by Chronarch. Abra rebelled against Chronarch and was deemed a criminal. He was banished to 20th Century Central City. With technology from the future, he crafted seemingly magical crimes that were always stopped by the Flash.

He was taken by a bounty hunter back to the 64th century where he was to be executed but Flash saved his life. Abra and Neron made a deal and he became a real sorcerer in the 21st century. Type (s) of intelligence: Science and Magic.

Leonard Snart (Captain Cold): In prison, Leonard Snart studied kinetic energy and thermal motion, realizing that absolute zero temperature would stop even the Flash. When he finally got out on parole, he broke into a lab and stole blueprints and a cyclotron to power his new weapon: the cold gun. Type (s) of intelligence: Science/Street Smarts.

Mick Rory (Heat Wave): Mick Rory who was obsessed with fire invented a handgun-sized flamethrower and wore an asbestos suit and committed crimes under the identity of Heat Wave. Type (s) of intelligence: Science

Alex Luthor Jr: Alexander Luthor Junior is the son of Alexander Luthor, the only hero of the dead Earth-3, he was in big part responsible of the events of Infinite Crisis. Working in the shadows along with Superboy-Prime he started to pull strings to manipulate everyone in order for the Crisis to start; in order to bring the multiverse back. Type (s) of intelligence: Science and Tactics/Strategy.

Lyons (Battalion): Lyons was a great musician and also the general of the rebellion that was against the reign of Lord Chaos in the false future that Extant had created. Type (s) of intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and arts.

Karen Beecher (Bumblebee): Super-smart Karen Beecher created a high-tech Bumblebee suit as part of a ruse to bolster her boyfriend Mal's reputation on the team. As a result, Bumblebee not only eventually joined the Teen Titans, she later married Mal as well. Type (s) of intelligence: Science

Danny Chase (Phantasm): Danny Chase is the son of two FBI agents and became one himself. Chase is also extremely smart and possesses a photographic memory. Formerly the youngest member of the new Teen Titans, this young hero died as Phantasm in the titans hunt storyline. Type(S) of intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Street Level

Isaiah Crockett (Hotspot): Isaiah Crockett's defining characteristic is that he is a genius. In fact he is so smart that when he was sixteen he was invited to take classes in a college,;he tried to enter college, however during his first day his powers manifested for the first time changing his life forever. Type(S) of intelligence: Science

Eddie Bloomberg (Kid Devil): One night Eddie Bloomberg decided to sneak into the workshop of Daniel Cassidy (Blue Devil). While there, he created for himself an armor that would be his superhero costume. The suit granted Eddie Bloomberg powers similar to the ones of Blue Devil. That was the night Eddie Bloomberg would become the hero known as Kid Devil, sidekick of Blue Devil. Type(S) of intelligence: Science.

General Immortus: General Immortus is a criminal whose lived for centuries with the use of a life-extending potion. He is one of the best strategists in the world. Type(S) of intelligence: Science and Strategy/Tactics

Steve Dayton (Mento): Steve Dayton, one of the world's richest men in DC Comics, built a helmet that enhanced his own latent mental abilities and began adventuring as the hero Mento. Type(S) of intelligence: Science, Strategy/Tactics and Arts

Paul Booker (Major Disaster): Paul Booker a former villain and also former member of the Justice League of America designed weapons that would help him cause extinction-level disasters. Type(S) of intelligence: Science/Engineering.

Felix Faust: Felix is a villainous sorcerer. He is around 5000 years old, and was one of the Justice League of America's first villains. Type(S) of intelligence: Magic

Oswald Cobbelpot (The Penguin): Intelligent, rich and sophisticated; Oswald Chesterfield Cobblepot is a distinctive villain in Batman's gallery of foes. His family history in Gotham City goes as far back as Batman's own. The Penguin is also the principal leader of the Gotham City mafia after the death of Black Mask. Type(S) of intelligence: Street Level and Arts, Engineering (trick umbrellas), Science (Ornithology).

T.O. Morrow: T.O. Morrow is the creator of the Red Tornado and the teacher of Doctor Will Magnus, inventor of the Metal Men. Type(S) of intelligence: Science

Talia al Ghul: The daughter of the head of the demon, Ra's al Ghul. She is the true heir of Ra's al Ghul making her heiress to the League of Assassins after her father's death. A master tactician, this woman is almost as lethal as her father. Type(S) of intelligence: Strategy/Tactics, Science, Street Smarts.

Bane: Known primarily as "The Man Who Broke The Bat", Bane was born inside the walls of Pena Duro ( "Hard Stone") prison to serve his father's sentence. While incarcerated, the man known only as "Bane" would pass the time by self-taught meditation, hard exercise, and reading as many books as he possibly could. As it turned out, Bane was possessed of a photographic memory, thus committing everything he read and did to memory. This, in combination with his education received from a Jesuit priest, is why Bane is considered by fellow genius Ra's Al Ghul as having "A mind equal to the greatest I have known". It should be noted that Bane is one of the few men to have deduced independently that Bruce Wayne is Batman.

Human Enhanced Intelligence

Human characters whose intellects have been increased using machines, serums or in any other artificial way.

Examples:

Deathstroke: Slade Wilson was a government project and meant to be the "ultimate human" and so he was given a serum meant to increase all his natural skills to near-metahuman levels. At first it seemed the serum was having a harmful effect yet things turned around and Deathstroke developed not only nigh-superhuman strength and reflexes but a superior intelligence as well making him an admirable foe. Types of Intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy and Criminal Intelligence.

  • Nathaniel Christopher Adam (Monarch):
  • Victor Stone (Cyborg):
  • Simon Jones (Psimon):
  • Hank Henshaw (Cyborg Superman):
  • Sasha Bordeaux (Checkmate’s black queen)
  • Characters that have been able to gain great intelligence partially due to their metahuman abilities.
  • Arthur Curry (Aquaman):
  • Tempest:
  • Thaddeus Thawne (Inertia):
  • Barry Allen (Flash):
  • Wally West (Flash):

Bart Allen: At one point, when Bart found himself unable to run any longer because of an injury caused by Deathstroke so instead of using his powers (as they were temporarily unavailable to him) he spent months in the libraries reading unceasingly. Eventually this caused him to store massive amounts of information in his head that he can call back instantly making him a somewhat super-genius. Type of Intelligence: Science.

Animal Geniuses

Characters that are originally ordinary Earth animals, however because of a superior evolution, experiments, etc have gained a great human-level intellect.

Examples:

  • Gorilla Grodd:
  • Monsieur Mallah
  • Detective Chimp
  • Rex the Wonder Dog

Alien Geniuses

Examples

The intellect of an alien whose IQ is determined because of the evolution of their species and not because of their powers.

  • Clark Kent/Kal-el (Superman):
  • Mister Miracle:
  • Sinestro:

Izaya (Highfather): Highfather was before his death the leader of one of the most powerful races in the Universe, the New Gods. He was a scientific and also was a great tactician. Type (s) of intelligence: Science, Tactics/Strategy.

  • Jor-El:
  • Kal Kent:
  • Metron:
  • Mon-El:
  • Orion:
  • Darkseid:
  • General Zod:

Machines

Characters that have artificial intelligence and great intellect because of being a computer

Examples:

  • Brainiac:
  • Brainiac-5:
  • Brainiac-12:
  • Brainiac-13:
  • Brother Eye:
  • Red Tornado:
  • Prestor John:
  • Indigo:

Divine Intelligence

Those that have been gave powers by divine beings that at the same time granted them great wisdom and knowledge

Examples

  • Billy Batson (Lord Marvel)
  • Freddy Freeman (Captain Marvel)
  • Mary Marvel:

Black Adam: Teth-Adam was Shazam's original champion and as such was gifted with many powers so that he could perform his heroic acts with ease whenever he called upon Shazam. However, his true personality was revealed when he possessed this power but Shazam could not take it away, so he has retained the Wisdom of Zehuti. This means that he is capable of knowing almost anything that he ever needs to know and will be counseled on the right course of action. Types of Intelligence: Science, Magic and Criminal Intelligence.

  • Amon Tomaz (Osiris):
  • Adriana Tomaz (Isis):
results.deck: A genius is a individual either human, alien, etc that has an intellect beyond that of an average representative of that species. Here is a list of comic characters from the DC Universe that can be considered geniuses.
results.name: DC Geniuses

results.description:
Overview

"Divine Right"
The Creation Equation is based on a series of futuristic hieroglyph-like symbols located on the Creation Wheel, an ancient artifact of unknown provenance. When translated into binary, these hieroglyphs create a string of numbers, the so-called "Creation Equation," that gives those in possession of the Equation access to the divine powers of the Creation Wheel and of creation itself, referred to as "divine right". Simply viewing the string of binary into which the equation has been encoded is sufficient to "download" the equation into a host, granting the host this divine right. Small parts of the equation, when viewed, can also endow limited elements of the power into those who view it. 
  
The Creation Equation creates godlike nigh-omnipotence in its human host. The host is capable of teleportation, reality alteration, reanimation of the dead (with no apparent ill effects to the reanimated individual), and numerous other abilities. It can also cause emotional and psychological disturbances in the human that hosts it.
results.deck: Composed of hieroglyphics found on the Creation Wheel, it is capable of granting superpowers to whoever observes it.
results.name: Creation Equation

results.description:
“Giles: A, a Slayer slays, a Watcher...

Buffy: ...watches?”

Watchers train and prepare vampire Slayers for their fated tasks. They are the Slayers’ contact with the Council. But more than that, Watchers are supposed to also teach the Chosen Ones what they need to learn in life, as a father would.

The Watcher must teach his o her Slayer to accept that they will not always win and that people will inevitably die. Life is not a fairy tale and most of the time happy endings do not occur.

As with the Slayer herself, if a Watcher perishes, the next one will be called. However, Watchers are fully aware of their role since they have use of reason and memory. They study all their lives and are eventually chosen by the Council to approach the Slayer. It is common practice that if a Watcher is to be replaced, the new one must come from a different family.

Who becomes a Watcher is determined by bloodlines. Offspring of previous members may become Watchers as well, and in most cases, they must.

They are researchers. Their duties rely heavily on the study of not just lore and prophecies, but previous Watcher’s journals as well.

As every Slayer is indeed different, their Watcher must adapt to her, not the other way around. Their job is not to force or demand anything from the Slayer, but rather to instruct and guide.
results.deck: The Watchers are a secret guild that have existed throughout history charged with training and maintaining the Slayers.
results.name: Watcher

results.description:
Overview

This concept appears in the comic book One Piece, which tells of the adventure of Monkey D. Luffy, the pirate captain, and his ship Going Merry (later replaced by Thousand Sunny), and his crews of Straw Hat Pirates. This manga is created by Eiichiro Oda. The current rooster of Straw Hat Pirates consists of Nami (the navigator), Roronoa Zoro (an ex pirate hunter who fights with three swords), Sanji (A Cook who fights with his feet), Usopp (A Mechanical Genius and Gunner) Nico Robin (An Archeologist, the only person alive who can read an ancient language), Tony Tony Chopper (an anthromorphic deer), Brook (the cane sword wielding animated skeleton), and Franky (the cyborg carpenter).

The devil fruit are powerful items that when there eaten they bestow its powers on the person but it comes at a price. The eater of the fruit can never swim again. Devil fruit are in fact, limited to one fruit per ability or form.  It has been suggested that they become extinct if someone eats the last one of a kind, but this is intrue: the fact is is that there is only one fruit per form or ability, and it will only regrow somewhere in the world if that person dies.  An example of this is the suke suke no mi, which allows the user to become invisible, Sanji was angry that someone had found and eaten this fruit which had the ability he wanted.  So short of murder or accident he would not be able to gain the invisibility power fruit he wanted.  
 
The fruits can be categorized as such: A Zoan type devil-fruit allows its user to turn into a half-animal, and full animal form, with the ability to mix and match all the features you wish from both forms, though users tend to adopt a singular recognisable form in general. It is said that carnivorous fruit users are particularly brutal. A Logia type devil-fruit allows its user to turn into, generate and control whatever element is associated with that fruit. This is not limited to the standard elements, it can include something as obscure as sand. Finally, there is the Paramecia type. This type of devil-fruit includes that which does not fit into any other category, and tends to give a singular ability which may come with a range of related abilities, such as Luffy's rubber body and stretching, or Buggy's anatomical seperation.


The following list are people who have consumed devil fruits, and their abilities.

  • Smoker =  Moku Moku no Mi, Logia (Smoke)
  • Portgas D. Ace =  Mera Mera no Mi, Logia (Fire)
  • Luffy = Gomu Gomu no Mi, Paramecia (Gives him the Elasticity and Electric-Resistant Properties of Rubber )
  • C rocodile = Suna Suna no Mi, Logia (Sand, Also allows moisture absorption from a person or a large area)
  • Mr.1 = Supa Supa no Mi, Paramecia (Allows him to turn any part of his body into a blade, and turns it into metal, which was said to be steel) 
  • Nico robin = Hana Hana no Mi, Paramecia (Can Replicate any body part on a surface which is in range)
  • Buggy the clown = Bara Bara no Mi, Paramecia (Allows him to Seperate parts of his body and control them remotely)
  • Tony Tony chopper = Hito Hito no Mi, Zoan (human type zoan fruit)
  • Eneru = Goro Goro no Mi, Logia (Electricity)
  • Mr. 3 = Doru Doru no Mi, Paramecia (Allows him to generate and possibly scuplt wax which when it hardens, becomes as hard, or harder than steel)
  • Miss Double Finger = Toge Toge no mi, Paramecia (Allows the user to grow spikes anywhere on their body)
  • Gecko Moria = Kage Kage no mi, Paramecia (Gives the user the ability to manifest and control shadows which when manipulated by him, can be inserted into corpses in order to create "Zombies" with the exact same skills and powers as the person it was taken from. Those who lose shadows will burn upon contact with sunlight, not unlike vampires)
  • Miss Valentine = Kilo Kilo no mi, Paramecia (Allows the user to change thier weight, her limit was said to be 1 to 10,000 kilograms, which may change if a stronger person gained it.)
  • Kalifa = Awa Awa no mi, Paramecia (Allows the user to emit and control soap and bubbles that can not only clean off dirt but can also "clean off" power)
  • Rob Lucci = Neko Neko no mi, Model: Leopard, Zoan

  • Pell = Tori Tori No Mi, Model: Falcon: Zoan

  • Mr. 2 = Mane Mane No Mi: Paramecia (Clone Clone fruit: Allows the user to change their appearance to any other they have touched to other humanoid forms, they might also gain their physical abilities)
results.deck: Fruits of the Sea-Devil
results.name: Devil Fruits

results.description:
The Homunculi are creatures created by using alchemy on the cells of an already living creature and injecting the cells into a human body. This process is made possible through the use of carrier embryos which enter the body and make their way to the brain, where they turn the human they have infected into a Homunculus. If the embryo is implanted directly into the brain, then the transformation will be almost instantaneous and almost painless, but if the embryo were to be injected at any other part of the body, it will cause severe pain to the person as it makes its way up to the brain. After the creature has become a homunculus, they gain many different powers, including invulnerability, healing, immortality, super strength, super speed, and a need to eat humans.

There are three different types of Homunculus:

Animal-Type Homunculus:

=======================

The Animal-Type Homunculus is the weaker of the two types, resulting when the carrier embryo is implanted with the cells of an animal and implanted into a human. When this happens, the human will be capable of transforming into the form of the animal from which the cells were taken, as well as being able to transform into a human. This transformation is severely harmful to the human host though, causing them to die, and their brain to be taken over by the experiences and instincts of the donor animal. The Animal-Type Homunculi become amazingly loyal to the human that created them, much as a pet becomes loyal to its owner, though some seem to be less loyal than others. Their power is entirely dependent on their animal and on their own will (as demonstrated by Kawazui’s being beaten by Kazuki Muto, but Washio being able to battle both Kazuki and Tokiko on equal terms.)

Plant-Type Homunculus

=====================

The Plant-Type Homunculi occur when the cells of a plant are placed into the carrier embryo. The Plant Type Homunculi are very similar to the Animal-Type Homunculi, as both have both a human and a “natural” form, and both the Animal and Plant-Types’ power is entirely based on their own strength and determination. The Plant-Type Homunculus are also arguably the easiest type of Homunculus to make, as Papillon’s first successful Homunculus was a Plant-Type, but this may also have only been a coincidence.

Human-Type Homunculus

=====================

The Human-Type Homunculi are the most powerful type of Homunculi, due to their ability to use the Kakugane, an ability reserved for humans. The Human-Type Homunculi are created when a Human uses his own cells in the carrier embryo, and he would then implant this embryo into their own body. This causes them to gain all the powers of a Homunculus without their minds being destroyed. In other words, they are able to keep their memories, their thought processes, and their ambitions.
results.name: Homunculus

results.description: The Hasslein Curve indicates that time is cyclical, but not necessarily that this cycle is fixed. Rather time should be thought of as a spiral perpetuating events interlocking with past and future. However, time travel changes these events and therefore the trajectory of the Hasslein Curve. In other words, divergent timelines appear when time travellers interfere.
results.deck: The Hasslein Curve is a type of time dilation theorised by Dr. Otto Hasslein of NASA during the 1970s. His theory was proven correct during the events chronicled in [[Planet of the Apes:vol:2699]].
results.name: Hasslein Curve

results.description:
Planet of the Apes ends with the immortal sound of the ocean lapping the empty shoreline whilst the ruined Statue of Liberty looks down on the last "true" man.

In comicbooks beyond number humans and human analogues are shown to be heading for Genesis-style apocalypse (although not necessarily a Flood) whenever and wherever they aspire too highly, develop technology that is too advanced, venture too far from their homeworld, or generally abandon a bucholic pastoral outlook.

One might call it the Gerber Hypothesis, after the somewhat misanthropist works of Steve Gerber in his Marvel heyday, a gauntlet since taken up by writers like Alan Moore.
results.deck: A strong theme runs through science fiction and the comics that take life from this genre: humanity is doomed by its own negative attributes.
results.name: Negative Human Nature

results.description:
Firebending

Iroh’s words of wisdom for the Fire Nation:

”Fire is the element of power. The people of the Fire Nation have desire and will, and the energy and drive to achieve what they want.”
Firebending

The firebenders, hailing from the fire nation, are capable of controlling heat, and are capable of amazing feats of fire manipulation and creation. The first firebenders, the Sun Warriors, were able to discover their abilities by studying the world’s natural fire benders, the dragons. Firebenders have shown themselves capable of using fire from various parts of their bodies, including, the hand, feet, and mouth, but to a rarer extent. Firebending seems to require steady breathing, or else the bender can lose control of their fire. Firebenders have shown shown themselves capable of propelling in the air through use of fire, but in only small bursts, as demonstrated by Azula.

During Sozin's Comet, firebenders are at their peak. Iroh, by himself, was capable of sending a giant ball of flame to burst a hole in Ba Sing Se's wall. Firebenders ( like Ozai) have themselves to be able to continuously float in the air and propel themselves by using fire coming from their feet. The fire formed by Sozin's comet has a significant reach compared to regular firebending.

Firebender also have different colors for fires. Traditional fire is red/orange. One exception is Azula's, who's fire is blue ( although it was the traditional color when she was younger.) Her seems to be more concussive as it was capable of busting through a wall of earth created by Aang. Varying colors seem to mean varying strengths.

The true nature of Firebending was hidden by fire lord Sozin when he began his war against the other nations. He instead began teaching all those under his control that the true power from the fire nation lay in their rage, and began making them angry at the other nations.

Firebending is based on the martial artist’s style of Northern Shaolin, focusing on strong kicks and long ranged attacks. However, they are also very capable of fighting close range with swift punches and jabs. The true strength of a firebender, though, is in their amazing speed and precision, and prodigal firebenders have been shown to be able to escape from four other capable benders without damage to themselves.

Lightningbending

Lightningbending, also known as the Cold blooded fire, is one of the most deadly

Lightning Bending

techniques available to a firebender. To bend lightning, a firebender must let go of all of their emotions, and then attempt to separate their good side from their bad side, their yin from their yang. However, due to the fact that the two are connected, they will eventually crash back together, and lightning is created. The Lightning is nearly impossible to survive, but this power is not at the mercy of the user. The user can only guide it out of them, and the lightning shall carve its own path through the air.

However, it is possible to redirect lightning. The technique for doing so was created by the amazing firebender Iroh as he watched waterbenders. To due so, one must guide the energy that the lightning creates through your hand, down your arm, through your stomach, and then out your other hand, sending the lightning away from you. However, if it were to go through your heart, then it would cause too much damage, making it deadly to the user. This makes this technique impressively deadly, but a true master can do it without fear of harming themselves.

Earthbending

Iroh’s words of wisdom on the Earth Kingdom:

”Earth is the element of substance. The people of the Earth Kingdom are diverse and strong.”

The Story of the earthbenders is the only story that has been explored in detail.

Earthbending

The story is of two warring sides, and two people on each side who discovered one another and fell in love. The two, by observing the badgermoles, learned to earthbend and carved out long elaborate tunnels that connected their two sides, and would meet secretly in the caves.

Earthbending is based off of the martial arts style of Hung Gar, though the character Toph Bei Fong’s style of earthbending is based off of Southern Praying Mantis style instead. It focus’s on having a strong, solid base that makes it almost impossible to move the earthbender when they are fighting. They are capable of moving unbelievable amounts of earth, making them unbelievably dangerous. Earthbenders have shown they can move through the ground as if it was air, and are more attuned to the air as well. Earthbenders can also bend mud ( since it's earth and water), and sand, but as shown by Toph, it isn't the easiest transition, although she becomes skillful enough in it to create a replica of Ba Sing Se, including some citizens.

Metalbending

Metalbending is a subsection of Earthbending that appears to have been created

Discovering Metal bending

by the blind Earthbender Toph. Due to metal being a purified form of earth, Toph was able to discover the impurities in the metals by using vibrations. Then, by bending these small impurities, Toph was able to bend the metal, effectively becoming the first ever Metal Bender.

The fact that it is possible to bend metal is of serious danger to those who attempt to imprison such a metalbender, as it used to be thought that imprisoning an earthbender was to keep them surrounded by something they could not bend, namely metal.

Though Toph does appear to be the only character capable of metalbending, it is very possible that King Bumi can actually bend metal, since he was shown bending while in a metal cage. However, his only comment about bending with his face makes this very unlikely. Aang can possibly bend metal in the future, seeing as though he has the same seismic sense Toph has (from training with her) and knows that even metal has some Earth inside it.

Airbending

Iroh’s words of wisdom on the Air Nomads:

”The Air Nomads detached themselves from worldly concerns, and found peace and freedom. Also, they apparently had pretty good senses of humour!"

The Airbenders, who lived in a similar fashion as Buddhist Monks, first learned

Airbending

how to manipulate air currents by watching the Sky Bison, as well as the winged Lemurs. Eventually, they became Nomads, and lived in one of four temples spread at the four different directions.

The Airbending style is based off of the martial arts style of Ba Gua, as well as Hsing Yi. An Airbender usually attempts to avoid al assaults sent their way, and will usually attempt to just wait for an opening in their opponent’s defense. The biggest advantage that they held in a fight was their inhuman speed, caused by their ability to manipulate the air around them. They were also able to summon great gusts, and some were even powerful enough to summon giant hurricanes. Airbenders had the capability to be some of the deadliest benders, due to the abundancy of air, their quick movements, and the capability of creating miniature tornadoes/twisters, funnels, slices of air capable of cutting rock etc. However, sue to their pacifistic nature, they don't do such things.

Airbenders have a great variety of offensive and defensive techniques, such as creating shields of air, concussive blasts shaped like the bender's body, and so on. Passively, they can run on waer ( because they're so fast) run up walls, and create air cushions to slow themselves down as they're in the air, so they don't the ground hard.

Unfortunately, the Air Nomads were all killed at the beginning of the war between the Fire Nation and the rest of the world. Only one of them actually survived the attack, The Avatar

Gliders

Airbenders use hand gliders to fly/glide. They are able to do this by manipulating

Gliding

the air currents around their gliders allowing them to do this. The glider is a stick concealing a two fans sort of things, one big one up top, and a smaller one at the bottom. Traditionally, the Airbender holds onto one of the wooden bars used to hold out the fan, and put their feet on a small bar on the bottom.

The Mechanist and Teo recently created a new glider for Aang. The gliders upper fan was smaller and it contained a bar up either end for Aang to hold onto. It also had a compartment used to store nuts.

Waterbending

Iroh’s words of wisdom on the Water Tribes:

”Water is the element of change. The people of the Water Tribe are capable of adapting too many things. They have a deep sense of community and love that holds them together through anything.”

For centuries, people have watched the tides caused by the slow push and pull of

Waterbending

the moon. A few people decided to attempt the same feat, and began teaching themselves how to manipulate the water. According to Princess Yue: "Our ancestors saw how it pushed and pulled the tides and learned how to do it themselves... Our strength comes from the Spirit of the Moon; our life comes from the Spirit of the Ocean. They work together to keep balance."

The style of waterbending is based off of the ancient Asian style of Tai Chi. It encompasses fluid and skillful movements to control the water, and a true master may appear to be in a sort of dance as they fight. They are capable of summoning giant waves, as well as controlling hips of water.

Healing

By using the properties of water, waterbenders are able to manipulate the

Healing

meridians to the point that they can heal multiple wounds, from cuts to burns. This healing has also been shown to help heal mental damage as well, and, with the help from spirit water, it has been shown to be able to bring someone back to life.

The healing that is taken on by waterbenders was usually taught to the women, who were believed to be useless in a fight, until this practice was stopped by Katara.

Bloodbending

Bloodbending is perhaps the darkest aspect of waterbending. Bloodbending can only be performed on the night of the full moon, when a waterbender is at their peek strength. A waterbender uses their increased power to control the fluids within a person, and cause them to do whatever the waterbender wishes. This can only be resisted by another waterbender.

The Avatar

EnergyBending

Energybending is the ability to bend life energy. It predates the main four bending

Energybending

arts, as well as the arrival of the Avatar and the formation of the Four Nations.

Before the arrival of the Avatar into the world, and the separation of the four elements, people bent the energy within themselves. They discovered the other four bending arts, and over time knowledge of Energybending was almost completely lost. The last known keeper of the art was an ancient Lion Turtle , who later passed it down to Avatar Aang who used it to remove Ozai's firebending forever.

The capabilities of Energybending are not well understood; what is known is that bending a person's life energy can impart them with knowledge instantly or remove one's bending completely. This bending art is dissimilar to the others because it is so perilous to the user, which is why so few have ever used it.

Dangers

Energybending is an extremely powerful and potentially dangerous technique. If the bender's spirit is even slightly weak (bendable), then they will be infected by the spirit of the one they are bending. As a result the bender can be corrupted and even killed.

Don’t underestimate the avatar

The Avatar is a special bender, with the ability to bend every element. It is an Avatar's duty to master each element, and keep peace throughout the world. After an Avatar dies he is reincarnated, circling the four nations, in the circle of water, earth, fire and air.

  • In the Avatar State, the Avatars' power is multiplied to an exponential length this usually occurs when the Avatar is in distress or when someone close to that individual is in duress.

Aang has been shown to be able to take the form of a giant fish monster when he was in this state.

Also when in this state, the Avatar is extremely vulnerable, which enables an enemy to attack and hurt the Avatar to near death extents.
results.deck: Benders exist in the world of Avatar:The Legend of Aang(aka Avatar:The Last Airbender)abd Avatar the legend of Korra.  Benders can bend one specific element (water, earth, fire or air). The Avatar is able to bend all four elements as well as a fifth element
results.name: Benders

results.description:
Nomination and Selection Process

Five judges are selected annually from different branches of the comic book community to comprise a panel to nominate works from the previous year in each category. The judges select from entries submitted to them by creators and publishers as well as any works not submitted they see as noteworthy. The judge's nominations are sent out to members of the comics industry to select a winner. Four or five candidates are nominated per category for work released in the prior year with the exception of the Hall of Fame. Inductees into the Hall of Fame are chosen from a list of around 16 candidates, typically two candidates are inducted by the judges and four are voted in by the industry voters. Winners are announced at Comic-Con in San Diego.

results.deck: The Eisner Awards recognize artistic excellence in the comic book industry. Created in 1987 and named after the legendary Will Eisner, the awards are presented annually at Comic-Con in San Diego.
results.name: Eisner Awards

results.description:
What's a Jedi?

The Jedi were much like the enforcers of the law, solving crimes, helping in wars and creating peace amongst the planets in different galaxies. The Jedi were very much respected, with the ability to create peace due to their wisdom and patience, and if ever needed, would be able to enforce the law physically thanks to their lightsabers and Force powers. However, due to the Jedi philosophies going against the natural flow of human life, some Jedi had turned to the dark side, and so the Sith were born. The line between Jedi and Sith (good and bad) were sometimes blurred, as the people thought that the Jedi did not make the best decisions, often leading to conflict and the destruction of planets.

Becoming a Jedi and Lifestyle

To become a Jedi, one must have a high enough midi-chlorian count and then be discovered by a Jedi Master. How the Jedi Master finds a potential Jedi is usually found by events that the Force creates, due to the Force being in every living form and therefore being connected to each other, no matter how direct or indirect. The Jedi Master will observe the Jedi-to-be and see if they have characteristics that are fit for a Jedi, such as commitment and an astute mind. The Jedi Master would also see if their emotions were in check, seeing as the Jedi thought that emotions such as anger and hate would lead to the dark side. The Jedi Code speaks of openness and no emotion:

There is no emotion; there is peace.
There is no ignorance; there is knowledge.
There is no passion; there is serenity.
There is no chaos; there is harmony. (Added in "Star Wars: KotOR")
There is no death; there is the Force.

There was also a new Jedi Code after the fall of the Empire:

Jedi are the guardians of peace in the galaxy.
Jedi use their powers to defend and protect, never to attack others.
Jedi respect all life, in any form.
Jedi serve others rather than ruling over them, for the good of the galaxy.
Jedi seek to improve themselves through knowledge and training.

Once a Jedi Master decided that the Jedi-potential person could be accepted in the ranks, their training began. They would start out as with the rank of "youngling", usually practicing with a remote, which was a small sphere that hovered just above the trainee's head. It would shoot small lasers that would sting, and the trainee would have to deflect it with their training lightsaber, which is a much weaker, non fatal version of a standard lightsaber used with the children as younglings. Once they had gained the rank of a Padawan, they were given the task of building their own lightsaber. They would have to find their own crystal however, and once they did, use their Force training to place and charge the cell. Even something as little as a misplaced crystal could blow up the lightsaber.

However, the main training of a Jedi was the Force. It is explained that the Force is an energy that runs through everyone. However, the Force in others is more prevalent and therefore can be trained as Jedi. The Jedi Masters always taught them to use the Force for good, such as healing, and if they needed to protect themselves, for defense, and never to be used with anger. Temptation of the dark side was always there, because it always seemed like the easier path to take. Some Jedi Knights would fall to the dark side and realize that they had taken a self-destructive path, but for many, it was too late. The journey back to the light side was difficult after being immersed so far in the Dark Side of the Force. Sometimes Dark Jedi could be saved, though most times it was not possible, and they would need to kill the Dark Jedi as a last resort.

The way of the Jedi was to help the weak, as opposed to the Sith, where the weak were to serve the strong. Since their lightsaber was such a strong symbol, they were to uphold the best behavior and have a great amount of responsibility. They were to have a clear mind and take care of things that were trivial, and they were required to have an open mind to all things, in order to learn how things work and come up with the best judgement from all they have learned. The Jedi were to wear a tunic and a cloak with a hood, boots and trousers, which were in shades of grey and brown/tan. This was in contrast to the what the Sith wore, which was black, and sometimes red. Due to the Jedi Code, they frowned upon emotions, attachments and materialism. They were to live a life of what seemed to be like poverty even though they had housing, food and clothing. They were never to love or even have sex, though there were certain instances, legal and illegal. One legal example was the Jedi Ki-Adi-Mundi, whose race suffered from low birth rates. From this, he was able to have a polygamous relationship and was a father to many children. An illegal relationship example would be Anakin Skywalker and Padme Amidala. This drove Anakin to the dark side and he became Darth Vader, though he was brought back to the light side, thanks to his son Luke.

Sects

The 3 sects of the Jedi are:

  • Dark Jedi
  • Potentium
  • Gray Jedi

Jedi Rankings

The rankings are as follow:

  • Jedi Youngling

  • Jedi Padawan

  • Jedi Knight

  • Jedi Master

  • Grand Master

More can be found here.

A Jedi Youngling would train until the master would decree that he/she would have enough knowledge in the Force to be put up to Padawan. Once a Padawan, they would be taken under the wing of a Jedi Knight; to become a Jedi Master, a Jedi Knight would have to train a Padawan sufficiently until they themselves could become a Jedi Knight. Once a Jedi Knight successfully trains a Padawan, the Knight is to become a Master. Other ways to becoming a Master would be to complete a heroic act. The highest rank was the Grand Master, where they have shown the utmost of wisdom. An example includes Yoda.

There were also Jedi who had a specialized class if the Jedi Order felt that their skills could be used else where. For example, there were Jedi known to lead armies into war, and Jedi who were interested in politics. There are Jedi classes called the Jedi Guardian, who focused on skills, but had limited use in Force powers, and Jedi Counselors, who specialized in the Force, but had limited fighting skills. There were also Jedi Sentinels who had focused on a balanced practice on the Force and their fighting capabilities. There were also Jedi Healers, and Jedi who took interest in preserving and learning about the culture and history of the Jedi, in hopes of learning past mistakes and improving themselves in the future. There were Jedi investigators, who basically acted as detectives, such as petty arguments to murder cases, and a class, called the Jedi Shadow was to spy on the Sith and expose them in order to prevent any wars between the Jedi and Sith. The Jedi Shadow would obviously have to have a very strong will, in order to fend against the dark side attacks.
results.deck: The Jedi are known as the protectors of the Star Wars universe. They wield the power of the force as well as the symbolic and powerful lightsaber against their foes.
results.name: Jedi

results.description:
The term demon has a myriad of uses in fiction mainly due to its emotive traditional meaning. demons are often characterized as devious and/or brutal beings deformed with horns and sometimes able to disguise their forms. They are exclusively on the side of evil and are tempters of people in order to obtain their souls or physical bodies to drag down to hell.

In some twists to the tradition characters such as Spawn is given demonic powers by a demon who then uses those powers to defy hell and his demonic master.

  • Suzaku
  • Suzuka
  • Toya
  • Yomi
  • Yukina
  • Younger Toguro
  • Yusuke Urameshi
  • Zeru
